DataElement.preferredName: Patient Specimen Availability Or Disease Biopsy Ability And Pretreatment Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the availability of specimens or the ability to biopsy disease and the patientÂ’s consent to pre-treatment biopsies.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Specimen Availability Or Disease or Disorder Biopsy Ability And Pretreatment Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment._Permission to do something._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Specimen Availability Or Disease or Disorder Biopsy Ability And Pretreatment Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.:Permission to do something.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is an archival tissue block o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is an archival tissue block or 10 formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) slides available or does patient have biopsiable disease and agrees to pre-treatment biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is an archival tissue block or 10 formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) slides available and does patient have biopsiable disease and agrees to pre-treatment and on-study biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If a patient opts out of a pre-treatment biopsy, biopsy is not possible, or if a pre-treatment biopsy does not yield sufficient tissue for analysis, is the patient willing to provide an archival FFPE specimen for LC/MS analysis of 2HG in order to enroll in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient agree to provide archival tumor material for research and/or agree to undergo a tumor biopsy for research if the tumor is accessible for biopsy prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have disease that can be safely biopsied and agree to a pre-treatment biopsy or have archival tissue available from within 12 months prior to registration?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.21 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0001812. ak
